availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Reddish (Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer, soldier, and justice of the peace. Benson, Kentucky, native. Son of Joseph Reddish. Married to Joan Welch Reddish. Father of George M. Reddish, Martha T. Reddish, and Joan Reddish. Married Kate Macey Reddish on December 21, 1863. Served in the 1st Kentucky Cavalry in the U.S.- Mexican War as a private from 1846 to 1848. Farmer in Franklin County in 1850. Farmer in Franklin County in 1860. Employed John Hathaway as a laborer in Franklin County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Franklin County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 66B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky,Franklin County, District 2, p. 327.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Bridgeport, p. 56B.
Index To Compiled Service Records Of Volunteer Soldiers Who Served During The Mexican War, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M616, Roll 031.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Film #994027-994058: Franklin, 1856, p. 6 of 7 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, “John H. Reddish (1822-1906)," Memorial # 6973430, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6973430/john-h.-reddish (accessed March 1, 2021).
